title: Reddit
cleaned_text: [r/medicine](/r/medicine/) r/medicine is a virtual lounge for physicians and other medical professionals from around the world to talk about the latest advances, controversies, ask questions of each other, have a laugh, or share a difficult moment. This is a highly moderated subreddit. Please read the rules carefully before posting or commenting. Quite furious. I had a patient 3 months post MI and drug eluting stent go to a naturopath for fatigue. Naturopath told the patient to stop taking plavix and their lisinopril. Gave them some supplements I've never heard of, and gave a patient with a hx of CAD and normal TSH armor thyroid (!!). How is this legal? And is there any boards I can report to for review of this persons license before they
